fields.headline: They said what?
fields.bodyText: 'The Clinton Foundation Intern Program offers a unique opportunity for growth, learning and meaningful service.' · An advertisement shows that you can't teach an old dog new tricks. 'The man is meant to be the alpha in a relationship on the money and power front, and clearly I was not.' · Model and budding actor Jamie Dornan is refreshingly honest about why he and Keira Knightly split up. He's B+ to us. 'I'm mildly insulted by being called camp ... it's a very complicated concept, actually. We're more an exercise in moroseness.' · Pet Shop Boy Neil Tennant sets us straight. 'I'm fed up with people saying I've had plastic surgery and lipo. Black don't crack.' · Naomi Campbell kicks off her case against the Botox pioneer Jean-Louis Sebagh who, she claims, says she endorses his products. 'The only way you can take a decision like that is to try and do the right thing, according to your conscience, and for the rest of it you leave it to the judgment that history will make.' · Tony Blair on his decision to go to war in Iraq, offered to terrifying chat-show host Michael Parkinson. 'That was horrible.' · Charles Saatchi delivers a devastating verdict on the quality of the prawn dansak cooked by his wife, Nigella Lawson. 'You should have sent him some packets of white powder.' · The Beast of Bolsover Dennis Skinner heckles Tory leader David Cameron, who once refused to answer questions about drug-taking. 'It will be as though he has poured a pint of blood on the memory of Gandhi.' · Arundhati Roy objects to George Bush's plans to pay tribute to the Indian pacifist and campaigner.
